pr_title: Issue 4944: Change granularity of Time based Retention Config in REST API

timeline.message:
Changed granularity of Time based RetentionConfig in REST API

Signed-off-by: pbelgundi <prajakta.belgundi@emc.com>

removed LIMITED_TIME enum and added doc

Signed-off-by: pbelgundi <prajakta.belgundi@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText: this can get NPE if getTimeBasedRetention is null.. do a precondition check before accessing its fields
timeline.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText: For old requests timeBasedRetention could be null..... so instead of a precondition check I have  added an explicit null check.
replies.author: pbelgundi

timeline.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText: This was not changed intentionally, but on regeneration these values did not get added... adding them back now.
replies.author: pbelgundi

timeline.bodyText: same here. revert these generated files
timeline.author: shiveshr

timeline.bodyText: why is this being changed here?
timeline.author: shiveshr

timeline.message:
New Unit Tests to cover all code paths

Signed-off-by: pbelgundi <prajakta.belgundi@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText:
the params for this method seem a bit odd, mills, hours and daysInMs.
can we make it consistent?
timeline.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText: I have added a javadoc and changed param names to make them more intuitive. Please check.
replies.author: pbelgundi

timeline.bodyText: please add more details to the javadoc
timeline.author: shiveshr
shiveshr
